frameDefinitions: An Experiencer has an emotion as caused by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
An Agent temporarily places a Theme into a Substance, often with the intention to remove it later.
In this frame, an Agent places the Theme in the Medium for an extended period of time, with the intent that the Theme will be affected by and absorb some of the Medium. '
Procedural or Medicine based Interventions are used on a Patient to attempt to alleviate a Medical_condition.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
An Item is in a state of wetness with the possibility of the wetting Liquid being mentioned, along with the Degree of wetness. '
frameExamples: I fall asleep hours later to the sound of their <t>engrossed</t> murmuring.
She <t>dunked</t> her sandwich into some tomato soup.
Ellen <t>soaked</t> the beans in the water for 30 seconds.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
The mop is <t>drenched</t> with water from last night's rain.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The Time when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is has a feeling about the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> places the <fen>Theme</fen> into a <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> temporarily goes partially or completely into the Substance.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the fluid into which the <fen>Theme</fen> is placed. This may be metonymically represented by the container of the fluid.
The location in time when the dunking occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the soaking.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the substance in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is submerged.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> soaks the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the submerging occurs.
A drug or procedure is administered or performed in order to treat a <fen>Medical_condition</fen>.
The consequence of the <fen>Intervention</fen>.
A holistic description of the medical state of the patient (or a part of the state of the patient), which may or may not indicate the cause of a deviation from normal.
The individual or team that attempts to improve the medical condition of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The <fen>Item</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates the <fen>Item</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
listRoleExamples: <fex>She</fex> dunked her sandwich into some tomato soup.
She dunked <fex>her sandwich</fex> into some tomato soup.
She dunked her sandwich <fex>into some tomato soup</fex>.
Ellen soaked <fex>the beans</fex> in the water for 30 seconds .
Bobby soaked the potatoes <fex>in water</fex> overnight.
Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
The mop was drenched <fex> with water</fex>.
